details.description:
Returns issues currently in existence. This data can take up to 9 hours to refresh
#### Required permissions

- `View Project` for every Organization in `filters.orgs`

- `View Organization Reports` for every Organization in `filters.orgs`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to request

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to return per page (Maximum: 1000)

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The key to sort results by

allOf.description: The key to sort results by

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The direction to sort results.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: Set to issue to group the same issue in multiple projects

allOf.description: Set to issue to group the same issue in multiple projects

error.name: ValidationError
innerErrors: invalid type filters.types is an invalid type unsupported-type

error.name: ValidationError
innerErrors: invalid type filters.types is an invalid type unsupported-type

details.description:
Returns any issues that are present during the specified timeframe. For example, if an issue from 2018 is still considered a vulnerable today, it will show up in all reports from its inception to the current day. This data can take up to 9 hours to refresh.**Note:** A vulnerability that was introduced and then resolved on the same day will not show up in the response.

#### Required permissions

- `View Project` for every Organization in `filters.orgs`

- `View Organization Reports` for every Organization in `filters.orgs`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The date you wish to fetch results from, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The date you wish to fetch results until, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to request

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to return per page (Maximum: 1000)

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The key to sort results by

allOf.description: The key to sort results by

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The direction to sort results.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: Set to issue to group the same issue in multiple projects

allOf.description: Set to issue to group the same issue in multiple projects

details.description:
Returns the number of tests conducted within a time frame. This data is updated in real time
#### Required permissions

- `View Project` for every Organization in `filters.orgs`

- `View Organization Reports` for every Organization in `filters.orgs`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The date you wish to count tests from, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The date you wish to count tests until, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: The field to group results by

allOf.description: The field to group results by

error.name: ValidationError
innerErrors: invalid type filters.isPrivate is not a Boolean

error.name: ValidationError
innerErrors: invalid type filters.isPrivate is not a Boolean

total.description: The total number of results found

orgs.description: The list of org IDs to filter the results by

languages.description: The type of languages to filter the results by

projects.description: The list of project IDs to filter the results by, max projects allowed is 1000

name.description: A descriptive message of the error

innerErrors.description: A list of additional reasons why the error occurred

project1.title: project1

url.description: URL to a page containing information about the project

source.description: The source of the project (e.g. github, heroku etc)

packageManager.description: The package manager for the project (e.g. npm, rubygems etc)

targetFile.description: The file path to the dependency manifest or lock file (e.g. package.json, Gemfile.lock etc)

project1.description: When no `groupBy` is used, a single project is returned per issue

true.description: The number of tests that prevented issues from being introduced

false.description: The number of tests that did not prevent issues from being introduced

orgs.description: The list of org IDs to filter the results by

severity.description: The severity levels of issues to filter the results by

types.description: The type of issues to filter the results by

languages.description: The type of languages to filter the results by

projects.description: The list of project IDs to filter issues by, max projects allowed is 1000

ignored.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are ignored, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not ignored

patched.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are patched, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not patched

fixable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are fixable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not fixable. An issue is fixable if it is either upgradable, patchable or pinnable. Also see isUpgradable, isPatchable and isPinnable filters.

isUpgradable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are upgradable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not upgradable

isPatchable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are patchable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not patchable

isPinnable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are pinnable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not pinnable

url.description: URL to a page containing information about the project

source.description: The source of the project (e.g. github, heroku etc)

packageManager.description: The package manager for the project (e.g. npm, rubygems etc)

targetFile.description: The file path to the dependency manifest or lock file (e.g. package.json, Gemfile.lock etc)

critical.description: The number of critical severity issues

high.description: The number of high severity issues

medium.description: The number of medium severity issues

low.description: The number of low severity issues

results.description: A list of project counts by day

true.description: The number of tests conducted against private projects

false.description: The number of tests conducted against public projects

results.description: A list of issue counts by day

orgs.description: The list of org IDs to filter the results by

isPrivate.description: If set to `true`, only include tests which were conducted against private projects, if set to `false` only include tests which were conducted against public projects

issuesPrevented.description: If set to `true`, only include tests which prevented issues from being introduced, if set to `false` only include tests which did not prevent issues from being introduced

projects.description: The list of project IDs to filter issues by, max projects allowed is 1000

issues.description: The list of issue IDs to filter issues by

identifier.description: Search term to filter issue name by, or an exact CVE or CWE

ignored.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are ignored, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not ignored

patched.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are patched, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not patched

fixable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are fixable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not fixable. An issue is fixable if it is either upgradable, patchable or pinnable. Also see isUpgradable, isPatchable and isPinnable filters.

isFixed.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are fixed, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not fixed

isUpgradable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are upgradable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not upgradable

isPatchable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are patchable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not patchable

isPinnable.description: If set to `true`, only include issues which are pinnable, if set to `false`, only include issues which are not pinnable
